**ask about other teams!**

Hello, friends!  Happy Monday.  This is a very special day to me.  On August 3rd, 2002, my wife Laura and I got married.  That makes today our 13th wedding anniversary, and as you know, 13 has always been a special number to me.  The day Laura joined me at the alter and became my wife was the greatest day of my life.  She is the most wonderful person I have ever known, and I love her with all my heart.  Happy Anniversary, Sweetheart!  
She reminded me that the day after our wedding I left early that morning to fly to Canton, Ohio, for the NFL Hall of Fame game, the first ever game for our Houston Texans.  We didn't have much of a honeymoon.  
If you would like to give us an anniversary present, please like my page ABC13-Dave Ward   I would deeply appreciate that.  Thanks.
Happy Anniversary Dave
Congrats Dave!  Wish you many more years together!
Happy Anniversary
best to both of you.
Congratulations Dave
Happy Anniversary Dave!!
Happy Anniversary
Happy Anniversary! Many blessings
Happy Anniversary To you & your wife. :)
happy anniversary & many more  <3

data.message: Curly, Mo and Larry, from the Houston Chronicle wouldn't know how to evaluate a mediocre QB, much less a good or bad one! For all of the years they have been sports writers,commentators, etc. they, combined, don't know S _ _ t from Shineola!!!!

some not so damning media attention and "shots fired" response is ALL AN OVERREACTION the whole way through.  damn i know it's august, it's hot and it's been almost as much time without football as we can stand but this is an overreaction on all accounts.
We got some non football knowing motherfuckers out there does anybody remember that he actually was offensive coordinator under Bill Belichick and coached Tom Brady
We all need to understand Hoyer had no O line and did ok and that going against two of the toughest Ds and won against them lost against them Mallett just have a chance with hall fame Qb

Good for Bill.  He's right we are proud we have two good quarterbacks putting it all out there and working so hard.  Everyone just needs to wait and see...  all I know is that I love my Texans!!  All of them!  Most especially those that work hard and don't take anything for granted.  Go TEXANS!!!!
Just as long as mallett starts I'm happy
Welcome to yesterday.

I'm a fan, not a coach.  It's all just typical mindless banter trying to find something to report on to try and validate their career choice.  I haven't followed any of the stories for that reason.  The QB decision is in very reliable, experienced hands.  I'll find out who's starting when the season starts.  I'm more concerned with who the corners are going to be, and if they can make more interceptions than #99.

I don't care who he picks because I trust him to do what HE thinks is best for our team!  Screw the media, esp 610!!  Keeping a positive attitude is hard as hell when you believe everything the media says!! Jmo!!
He's spot on.
In case you missed it, make sure you see the 'kiss' heard around the world.

JJ Watt can't get anymore perfect. Playing with kids at the local  YMCA, he's a good player, and just the smile on his face after that little girl kissed him on the cheek. His parents have done an amazing job raising him. I hope his little brothers are the same.
aww! she's so adorable! JJ Watt is such a great guy.
LOVE IT!!! & look at JJ's smile when it happens!!, he's such a great man & role model for kids!!! Proud to have him on our Houston team!!!
She saw her chance and she took it. :-)
Smart girl.
I would have kissed him to! lol
Adorable!
Sneaky little thing!  Stealing a kiss and he loved it!
Lucky little lady!!!
I don't blame her I would have kissed him as well.
Lucky girl!!
Lori, think people would have the same reaction if you tried this???? :)
I'm next!!!!
I would've died if I kissed him he's such a great person!
Lucky Girl 💋
Sweet!😄
